intro: Acleisanthes megaphylla, commonly known as the giant leaf datura, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its large, showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale purple in color. The plant produces egg-shaped, greenish-brown fruits that contain numerous seeds. Its leaves are broad and heart-shaped, often with a waxy coating. Acleisanthes megaphylla is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
